newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka tyre industry seeks lower Indian import.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka tyre industry seeks lower Indian import.

text.p: A top Sri Lankan tyre exporter said on Tuesday that India's latest liberalisation of tyre imports was unlikely to help the local industry unless import duty was slashed substantially.
"It will not really affect us. We're asking for a reduction in import duty," said Tilak de Zoysa, managing director of Associated Motorways Ltd.
"It is not worthwhile for us to export to India at 25 percent duty. A viable import duty would be 5-10 percent," he told Reuters.
AMW has a tyre manufacturing facility in a joint venture with India's Ceat group.
India's Commerce Ministry said on Monday it had shifted tyres and some fertilisers from a restricted list of imports to a list of freely importable items.
The imports liberalised under a new five-year export-import policy include tyres of motor cars, motor cycles, scooters, tractors, and used and retreaded tyres and rubber tubes.
